column1: Khardaha is a city and a municipality of North 24 Parganas district in the Indian state of West Bengal. It is near Kolkata and also a part of the area covered by Kolkata Metropolitan Development Authority (KMDA).
Initially Khardah was a part of South Barrackpore and West Barrackpore municipalities established in 1877. South Barrackpore Municipality was renamed Khardah Municipality in 1920.
Khardaha is located at 22.72°N 88.38°E﻿ / 22.72; 88.38. It has an average elevation of 15 m (49 ft). It has a railway station on the Sealdah-Ranaghat section
column2: sandwiched between Sodepur and Sukchar (to the south) and Titagarh (to the north). The railway station divides the town into two parts - the eastern part is known as Rahara
column3: while the western part is known as Khardaha.
